title: Use uploaded image as VOXA app logo

requirements.text: Save the uploaded VOXA logo image (white abstract V-shaped mark with purple shadow on black background) as a static asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/voxa-logo.png and render it in the Hero section (HeroSection.tsx) in place of the current SVG sound-wave icon, displayed at an appropriate size (e.g., 64×64 px) next to the 'VOXA' wordmark.
acceptanceCriteria: The uploaded logo image is saved as frontend/public/assets/generated/voxa-logo.png
The Hero section displays the logo image instead of the previous SVG icon
The logo is visually aligned next to the 'VOXA' text heading
The logo renders correctly on both desktop and mobile viewports
The previous sound-wave SVG icon is removed from the Hero section

requirements.text: Also display the VOXA logo image (voxa-logo.png) in the sticky Navigation bar alongside the 'VOXA' brand name, replacing any existing SVG icon used there, at a small size appropriate for a navbar (e.g., 32×32 px).
acceptanceCriteria: The navigation bar shows the voxa-logo.png image next to the 'VOXA' text
The logo is scaled appropriately for the navbar (approximately 32×32 px)
Any previous SVG brand icon in the navbar is removed
The navbar layout remains intact and responsive on mobile

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui
The logo image must be served as a static asset from frontend/public/assets/generated/, not through the backend
nonGoals: Redesigning or altering the uploaded logo image
Changing any other section content or branding text

edits: Crop to tight bounds around the white abstract V-shaped mark with purple shadow, removing the black background, and export with a transparent background (IMG_20260208_191015_825.webp > voxa-logo.dim_256x256.png)
